thread.title: High school football scouting report
thread.title_full: High school football scouting report - San Antonio Express-News

author: Terrence Thomas
title: High school football scouting report
text:
Express-News staff writer Terrence Thomas sets the stage for what to watch for this weekend:
Key storyline
Surprising struggles: If you had asked before the season, most would have figured that Friday’s District 28-6A game between East Central and Southwest would carry high stakes.
The fact the contest isn’t for the inside track to the 28-6A title - but to keep from suffering a huge blow to playoff aspirations - speaks to how both teams’ seasons have unfolded.
East Central and Southwest are both 1-5 and are coming off losses in their district openers - East Central 49-28 to Corpus Christi Carroll , Southwest 42-3 to CC King.
The teams play at 7:30 p.m. Friday at Southwest.
Under the radar games
Louise at Falls City, 7:30 p.m. Friday: First place in District 14-2A-II will be on the line in this matchup of unbeaten teams. Don’t be surprised if the game is a low-scoring affair.
Falls City (7-0) has three shutouts and has allowed only 48 points this season. Louise (6-0) has allowed 51 points and has two shutouts.
Boerne at Fredericksburg, 7:30 p.m. Friday: The Battlin’ Billies can remain in a tie for first place in District 14-4A-I with a win, while Boerne needs a victory to avoid a 0-2 start in league play after last week’s 42-28 loss against Taylor.
By the numbers
3: Consecutive wins for Antonian over TAPPS 2-I rival Central Catholic - its longest winning streak in the series.
The Apaches have outscored Central Catholic by a combined 110-35 the past three meetings. The Buttons (4-2, 1-0) had won 21 of the previous 22 games before Antonian (3-3, 0-1) snapped its drought.
The squads meet at 7:30 p.m. Friday at Benson 66 Stadium.
4.7: Points per game Blanco’s defense has allowed through six games this season. The Panthers (6-0) have registered two shutouts and haven’t allowed more than seven points in any game.
The point total is better than a year ago at this time when Blanco yielded 5.5 points en route to finishing 14-1 and advancing to the Class 3A Division II state semifinals. The Panthers play at Nixon-Smiley at 7:30 p.m. Friday.
45.7: Points per game Brandeis has averaged during its three-game winning streak, including twice scoring more than 50 points. The Broncos (3-3) have averaged 526 yards en route to wins over New Braunfels, Taft and Holmes.
Brandeis averaged 14 points and 259.3 yards in its first three games under new coach Jeff Fleener - losses to Johnson, Judson and Pflugerville Hendrickson.
The Broncos play Marshall in a District 27-6A Zone B contest at 7:30 p.m. Friday at Farris Stadium.
